page.title: 08HALGAVOR FARM
page.content: The farm is owned by Mr. and Mrs. James and is a mixed farm. It comprises of 34 fields of which 5 are leased from the local council and 1 is rented to the owner of Ashleigh. The land is mainly used for grazing and hay, but 5 fields of winter corn are also grown. There are:- 45 milking cows, mainly fresians - 80 young stock,ranging from 2 years old to calves, which Mrs. James looks after - approx. 100 Suffolk cross sheep - 3 horses and a variety of free-range poultry: hens: ducks: geese and guinea-fowl. Mr. James has his own farm implements and crushes his corn using a mill which was originally powered by a water wheel, but is now driven by a belt connecting it to a tractor. The rest of the mill still exists.
